text: I fear my colleagues in Justus Lipsius could be in for a long night...
author: ChrisWimpress

text:
I've a spare ticket to see Trainspotting at the Tower Theatre in Stokie tonight... does anyone want it?

http://www.towertheatre.org.uk/train.htm
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Oui, lui a le compris tres bien :)
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Sir John Curtice @whatukthinks tells @BBCWorldatOne "There are now more people who think MPs should support the deal than oppose it." #bbcwato
author: ChrisWimpress

text: KLAXON @JohnCurticeOnTV is on World at One right now #bbcwato
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Tory MP Charles Walker tells @BBCWorldatOne if the May deal falls on a third vote 'There will be a delay... delays of a few weeks can become a few months... can become a few years.' #bbcwato
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Tory MP Ben Bradley tells @BBCWorldatOne he is now 'not sure' if he will vote for the May deal in the next meaningful vote, saying the May statement was 'not helpful'.  #bbcwato
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Nicky Morgan tells @BBCWorldatOne that the PM's statement last night was 'terribly misjudged', and says there will be MPs who will be 'put off' voting for the deal. 'It makes people more entrenched, just at the moment where maximum flexibility is needed' #BBCWATO
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Former Swedish PM Carl Bildt tells @BBCWorldatOne a no-deal will be "the mother of all crises, even by Brexit standards" and would poison attempts to secure a future relationship. He blames "simplistic Brexiteers" for the crisis. #bbcwato
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Rather striking that more than half of the top ten trending things in Britain now on Twitter are about a statement by the Speaker of the @HouseofCommons
author: ChrisWimpress

text: You need to find Skunk (Sonically speaking). I think that would be a good soundtrack for the next 12 days
author: ChrisWimpress

text: It's not all bad news (if you are from Northampton)
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Bercow confirms: perfectly possible to over-ride Erskine May with any motion it likes. Just has to get through.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Perfectly possible and MPs who wanted to vote down MV3 might well want the opportunity to do so. Many still want to kill the deal.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Andrea Leadsom is now having a major pop at Bercow, saying she wouldn't have confidence in him running a Speakers Conference because she wouldn't believe people would be treated with respect (this is her reminding him she thinks he's a bully).
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Bercow 'if there is a substantially different proposition' as a result of EU council changes 'sought and obtained' then MV3 could happen - he appears to be digging in on the idea this can't just be a domestic tweak to the documents.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: I think that accolade lies with @estwebber
author: ChrisWimpress

text: I gave up on predictions long ago. Extend/No deal/General Election/Tory leadership contest/Cancel Brexit/Military Coup. All up for grabs.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: It seems everyone with a dog in the fight seems to think this ruling benefits their preferred Brexit scenario.
author: ChrisWimpress

text:
Kate Hoey is suggesting that similar SNP amendments have appeared on different motions - so why were they allowed?

Bercow : Nobody asked me to rule on them, so I didn't.
author: ChrisWimpress

text:
Bercow says he didn't make this statement before today because it wasn't required (ie MV2 was substantially different from MV1).

The difference now is that it appears the EU is not prepared to negotiate further one iota.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: James Cleverly is now audaciously suggesting that if MPs had known this ruling from Bercow was coming they might have voted for MV2 in greater numbers. Does anyone think that?!
author: ChrisWimpress

text:
Hillary Benn wants to know if changes would now have to be to the WA/PD - ie agreed in EU Council, rather than just unilateral domestic declaration.

Bercow: In all likelihood the answer is yes.

That is potentially BIG.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Bercow replies to Francois: 'Everything depends on the context and circumstance... manifestly and incontrovertibly' - ie it's up to me to decide what's in order and what's not.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: ERGer Mark Francois is now asking if (and tacitly suggesting that) Cooper/Boles and Benn were essentially the same but were allowed by Bercow....
author: ChrisWimpress

text: I'm not sure but it could mean that the Kyle/Wilson could have to be tweaked but better heads will know whether it's currently substantially the same as Spelman/Cooper
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Bercow sets 'the test that government must meet' for there to be a MV3 (or MV3+++) - Does gov need more from this week's EU Council, or further unilateral declarations? That will be the question but arguably a tricky situation for No10 just got harder.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Bercow says statement 'designed to signal what would be orderly and what would not' on MV3 - or MV4. They cannot be 'the same or substantially the same' as MV2 last week. So something meaningful has to change.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Bercow says the second meaningful vote last week did NOT fall foul of rules because it 'could be argued it was a different proposition' to the first one in January....
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Whatever Bercow is building up to , he's getting there via a narrative verdict of the gov's handing of Brexit votes. It's not a flattering verdict.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Yeah that's why I was intrigued ..... all very odd.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Is she in New York? I don't recognise the skyline.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: We'll hopefully hear no more barbs about the Welsh 'tiring' after yesterday.
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Also on World This Weekend @JonnyDymond speaks to Lab MP Emma Lewell-Buck @EmmaLewellBuck on how she would vote in MV3. Plus Andrea Jenkyns @andreajenkyns on why she's definitely not for turning. Radio 4 at 1300. #WATO #TW2 #Brexit #MV3
author: ChrisWimpress

text: On World This Weekend, Radio 4 at 1300: Daniel Kawczynski @DKShrewsbury on why he's switched to the May Deal, Bronwen Maddox @bronwenmaddox and Garvan Walshe @garvanwalshe discuss if the constitution itself is broken by Brexit. With @JonnyDymond #WATO #TW2 #Brexit
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Errrr. Hammond has now said on #marr that they won't bring the deal back this week unless they can be sure they can win. But adds that a 'significant number have changed their view on this.'
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Philip Hammond has just told #marr that MV3 will happen this week. Liam Fox suggested on #ridge it shouldn't happen until gov is sure it can win. Who speaks for the government these days?
author: ChrisWimpress

text: It was an amazing match albeit life-shortening to watch as an England supporter. https://twitter.com/Scotlandteam/status/1107229975965560834 …
author: ChrisWimpress

text: Well thrashing Scotland feels good on so many levels. #eng #6n
author: ChrisWimpress

text: This sort of PR could've swung 2015 for him.
author: ChrisWimpress
